intro: Hesperastragalus peonis, commonly known as the peony milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in early summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Hesperastragalus peonis is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, making it an important component of local flora in those regions.
